summary: This is an email forwarded by Mark Fragria, originally sent by Mark Epstein to Stacey Richman on September 22, 2021. The email's subject is 'JE3' and contains a brief, graphic analysis disputing the official cause of Jeffrey Epstein's death, suggesting evidence of a garroting rather than a hanging.

persons.name: Mark Fragria
persons.context: Appears as the initial sender/forwarder of the email chain containing Mark Epstein's message about Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Authored the original email to Stacey Richman, providing a forensic analysis arguing that Jeffrey Epstein's death was not a suicide by hanging but more consistent with a garroting.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Was the intended recipient of Mark Epstein's email discussing the forensic details of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE3' in the subject line; the email analyzes the forensic evidence surrounding his death in prison, contesting the official narrative.

connections.description: Mark Epstein sent an email to Stacey Richman containing his analysis of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Mark Epstein is discussing and analyzing the forensic evidence of Jeffrey Epstein's death, indicating a connection or interest in the case.
Mark Fragria forwarded an email that originated from Mark Epstein.

events.title: Analysis of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Mark Epstein sends an email contesting the official cause of Jeffrey Epstein's death, arguing forensic evidence (neck groove) suggests garroting, not hanging, and that he was dead for 2-6 hours when found.

keyFacts: The document contains a forensic claim that a neck groove on Jeffrey Epstein's body proves he was dead for 2-6 hours when found.
The analysis argues the groove does not match a sheet noose, is too narrow (like an electric cord), and is low on the neck, which is more consistent with a garroting than a hanging.
The email, sent by Mark Epstein to attorney Stacey Richman, directly challenges the official narrative that Epstein died by suicide in his prison cell.
